segments.text: Hi, Deepak. Thanks for taking my call today. I'm Linda from Noodli. I'm really interested in learning more about your offering. I've been hearing good things about what you're doing.
Hey. So Slack, I think would be, uh, great for you guys if you, uh... Actually, before we get into that, I wanted to understand what you're looking for.

Well, we're having some challenges with our internal communication at Noodli. Our team has grown pretty quickly in the past year, and honestly, things are getting a bit messy. Information gets lost. People miss important updates. It's frustrating. I'd love to hear how you might help with that.
And could I ask you what you're using for internal communication now?

We're mostly using email, and we have this old messaging system. I forget the name, but it's really clunky. Some teams are also using WhatsApp groups, which isn't ideal for work stuff. It's all over the place, to be honest.
I see. I see. And, uh, could you tell me, uh,
what people use whe- do you have anything in terms of a knowledge base or something that you can look up for information?

Right now, it's kind of scattered. We have some shared Google Docs, and there's a wiki that hardly anyone updates anymore. The marketing team has their own system, and product keeps stuff in Notion, but there's no central place where everyone can find what they need. Sometimes I spend way too much time just tracking down basic information.

I see. I see. So let me tell you a little bit about how Slack works and why, uh, personally, you know, we find Slack helps us to do a lot of things with a really simple tool. So, uh, to start with, Slack focuses on using chat as the primary way of communication. So texting, uh, is how you could think about it. So not so different from WhatsApp but built for professional communication within your team, right? And so, uh,
I think to start with, what's really great about Slack is just
how easy it makes it to organize all your conversations, right? And it does this through a few simple, uh, tools that we put-
